properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 9:56AM PST until January 12 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...NEXT STORM SYSTEM MOVING IN SUNDAY...

.Our next weather system will move in early Sunday bringing heavy
snow to the passes of the Cascades and the Northern Idaho
Panhandle. Breezy conditions, especially on exposed ridges, will
create areas of blowing snow which could significantly reduce
visibility. Snow levels will hover around 1500 ft allowing heavy
snows even to the lower elevations.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected for The Cascade Crest including
Highway 2 between Coles Corner and Stevens Pass. Total snow
accumulations of 4 to 15 inches.

* WHERE...Mazama, Stehekin, Plain, and Holden Village.

* WHEN...From 1 AM to 4 PM PST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
